summary: The FEHB Protection Act of 2025 aims to improve oversight and eligibility verification for the Federal Employees Health Benefits (FEHB) program. It mandates the Director of the Office of Personnel Management to establish processes for verifying family member eligibility and assessing fraud risks. The bill also provides funding for audits, oversight, and administrative services related to the FEHB program, including the Postal Service Health Benefits Program. It amends existing legislation to ensure proper resource allocation and accountability within the FEHB program.
